Package com.advertisementproject.campaignservice.db.entity

Class Campaign

java.lang.Object
com.advertisementproject.campaignservice.db.entity.Campaign
@Entity
public class Campaign
extends java.lang.Object
Campaigns are the main responsibility of the Campaign Service application and contain information about the campaign itself for advertising products or services to customers. Fields include validation. Each campaign is tied to a company, which are updated when the application receives messages from the User Service application. If a company is removed then all related campaigns are also removed.
Json View:
restricts the response information shown to only the annotated fields if a controller has set a view.

  • Field Details

    • id

      @NotNull private @NotNull java.util.UUID id
      Primary id for Campaign entity.

    • title

      @NotNull @Size(min=2, max=20, message="Title must be between 2-20 characters long") private @NotNull @Size(min=2,max=20,message="Title must be between 2-20 characters long") java.lang.String title
      Title for the campaign.

    • description

      private java.lang.String description
      Optional description for the campaign.

    • discount

      @NotNull @Min(value=1L, message="Discount must be at least 1 (percent or in currency)") private @javax.validation.constraints.NotNull,@javax.validation.constraints.Min(value=1L, message="Discount must be at least 1 (percent or in currency)") double discount
      Discount which can either be a fixed amount or a percentage, determined by the field "isPercentage".

    • currency

      private java.util.Currency currency
      Currency for the campaign. Currently is automatically set to SEK but is available as a field for future market expansion which will prevent lots of potential issues from database migration.

    • isPercentage

      @NotNull private @javax.validation.constraints.NotNull boolean isPercentage
      Determines whether field "discount" is a percentage (true) or a fixed amount (false).

    • image

      @Size(min=1000, message="Too short. Image must be in base64 string format") @Pattern(regexp="^data:image/.*$", message="image string must begin with \'data:image/\' image descriptor") private @Size(min=1000,message="Too short. Image must be in base64 string format") @Pattern(regexp="^data:image/.*$",message="image string must begin with \'data:image/\' image descriptor") java.lang.String image
      Image file stored as a base64 formatted string (text type in the database).

    • category

      @NotNull @Size(min=2, max=20, message="Category must be between 2-20 characters long") private @NotNull @Size(min=2,max=20,message="Category must be between 2-20 characters long") java.lang.String category
      Category that declares the type of campaign, for example "clothing" or "travel".

    • createdAt

      @NotNull private @NotNull java.time.Instant createdAt
      Timestamp for when the campaign is created.

    • publishedAt

      @NotNull private @NotNull java.time.Instant publishedAt
      Timestamp for when the campaign is published. Can be set to publish immediately by not supplying a publishedAt value in the request when creating a campaign. Must be a valid future date when explicitly set by a request.

    • expiresAt

      @NotNull private @NotNull java.time.Instant expiresAt
      Timestamp for when the campaign expires. Must be a later date than "publishAt" field if supplied in the request. Set by default to 60 days after "publishAt" date if no value is set in the request.

    • updatedAt

      private java.time.Instant updatedAt
      Timestamp for when the campaign is updated.

    • isPublished

      private boolean isPublished
      Field for quickly checking if a campaign is published without needing to check dates when fetching published campaigns. Is set to true if current timestamp is after "publishAt", otherwise false. There is a scheduled job that automatically sets campaigns to published if "publishAt" is in the past.

    • discountCode

      @NotNull @Size(min=2, max=20, message="Discount code must be between 2-20 characters long") private @NotNull @Size(min=2,max=20,message="Discount code must be between 2-20 characters long") java.lang.String discountCode
      Discount code to be used to partake in whatever offer the campaign is about and is hidden from users who are not logged in. Logged in customers may fetch the discount code via a separate endpoint.

    • company

      private Company company
      The company that created the campaign and manages it. Company id is hidden from non logged in users. Company table gets updated via messages from User Service application.

  • Constructor Details

    • Campaign

      public Campaign()

  • Method Details

    • toCampaign

      public static Campaign toCampaign​(Company company, CampaignRequest request)
      Builder method for constructing a campaign from a company and a campaign request. If publishedAt timestamp is provided in the request and it's a future timestamp then the campaign is set to be published at that later time, otherwise it will be set to published with the current timestamp. If expiredAt timestamp is provided in the request and it's at a later timestamp than the publishAt timestamp then that expiredAt timestamp is set, otherwise expiredAt is set to 60 days after publishAt by default.
      Parameters:
      company - the company that created the campaign
      request - request object containing information for making the campaign
      Returns:
      campaign with information provided from the request, belonging to the company provided
